question:
Which of the following are the qualifications for a person to be chosen as a member of the state legislature?
1. He must be a citizen of India
2. He must make and subscribe to an oath or affirmation before the person authorised by the Election Commission for        this purpose.
3. He must be not less than 30 years of age in the case of the legislative council
4. He must posses other qualifications prescribed by Parliament
Select the correct options from the codes given below:
explanation: A person must possess following qualifications to be chosen as a member of the state legislature- (1) he must be a citizen of India, (2) he must make and subscribe to an oath or affirmation before the person authorised by the Election Commission for this purpose, (3) he must be not less than 30 years of age in the case of the legislative council & not less than 25 years in case of legislative assembly, (4) he must posses other qualifications prescribed by Parliament.
